description: Unique ID of a Zendesk ticket
name: id

description: Timestamp with one-second precision of when the ticket was created.
name: created_at

description: Timestamp with one-second precision of when the ticket was created.
name: updated_at

description: The url of the ticket in Zendesk.
name: ticket_url

description: The external ID of the ticket, if it exists.
name: external_id

description: Timestamp with one-second precision of when the ticket was created.
name: generated_timestamp

description: The type of the ticket, such as 'incident', 'problem', 'question', or 'task'.
name: type

description: The subjext of the ticket, which is a short summary of the issue.
name: subject

description: The raw version of the subject, which may include HTML or other formatting.
name: raw_subject

description: The priority of the ticket, which can be 'low', 'normal', 'high', or 'urgent'.
name: priority

description: The status of the ticket, which can be 'new', 'open', 'pending', 'hold', 'solved', or 'closed'.
name: status

description: The intended recipient of the ticket, which can be a user or an organization.
name: recipient

description: The ID for the requester of the ticket, which is the user who created the ticket.
name: requester_id

description: The ID of the submitter of the ticket, which may be different from the requester if the ticket was created on behalf of another user.
name: submitter_id

description: The ID of the assignee of the ticket, which is the user responsible for resolving the ticket.
name: assignee_id

description: The Organisation ID of the requester, if the requester is part of an organization.
name: organization_id

description: The ID of the group that the ticket is assigned to, if applicable.
name: group_id

description: The ID of the collaborator of the ticket, which is a user who can view and comment on the ticket but is not the assignee.
name: collaborator_ids

description: The ID's of the followers of the ticket, which are users who can view the ticket but are not assignees or collaborators.
name: follower_ids

description: The ID of cc email addresses associated with the ticket, which are used to send notifications to users who are not directly involved in the ticket.
name: email_cc_ids

description: The ID of the forum topic associated with the ticket, if applicable.
name: forum_topic_id

description: The ID of the problem associated with the ticket, if it is part of a problem ticket.
name: problem_id

description: Indicates if a ticket has incdents.
name: has_incidents

description: Indicates if a ticket is public or private.
name: is_public

description: The date the ticket is due, if applicable.
name: due_at

description: A list of the tags associated with the ticket, which can be used for categorization or filtering.
name: tags

description: The ids of a sharing agreement associated with the ticket, if applicable.
name: sharing_agreement_ids

description: The ID of the custom status associated with the ticket, if applicable.
name: custom_status_id

description: The encoded ID of the ticket, which is a unique identifier used in URLs.
name: encoded_id

description: The followup IDs associated with the ticket, which are used to track follow-up actions or related tickets.
name: followup_ids

description: The Ticket form ID associated with the ticket, which is used to determine the fields and layout of the ticket.
name: ticket_form_id

description: The brand ID associated with the ticket, which is used to identify the brand or company that the ticket belongs to.
name: brand_id

description: Indicates if channel back is allowed for the ticket.
name: allow_channelback

description: Indicates if attachments are allowed for the ticket.
name: allow_attachments

description: Indicates which form messaging channel the ticket is from, such as 'web', 'email', 'chat', etc.
name: from_messaging_channel

description: Indicates the type of ticket, such as 'incident', 'problem', 'question', or 'task'.
name: ticket_type

description: Indicates the channel through which the ticket was created, such as 'web', 'email', 'chat', etc.
name: via_channel

description: Indicates if a ticket is via a source relationship, such as 'email', 'web', 'api', etc.
name: via_source_rel

description: Indicates the satisfaction rating score for the ticket, if applicable.
name: satisfaction_rating_score

description: Indicates the metric set ID associated with the ticket, which is used for performance metrics.
name: metric_set_url

description: Indicates the metric set ID associated with the ticket, which is used for performance metrics.
name: metric_set_id

description: Indicates the metric set ticket ID associated with the ticket, which is used for performance metrics.
name: metric_set_ticket_id

description: Metric set create at timestamp, which indicates when the metric set was created.
name: metric_set_created_at

description: Metric set update at timestamp, which indicates when the metric set was last updated.
name: metric_set_updated_at

description: Metric set group stations, which indicates the stations associated with the metric set.
name: metric_set_group_stations

description: Metric set reopens count, which indicates the number of times the ticket has been reopened.
name: metric_set_reopens

description: Indicates the metric set replies count, which is the number of replies in the ticket.
name: metric_set_replies

description: Indicates teh metric set assignee updated at timestamp, which is when the assignee was last updated.
name: metric_set_assignee_updated_at

description: Indicates the metrics set requester updated at timestamp, which is when the requester was last updated.
name: metric_set_requester_updated_at

description: Indicates the metrics status updated at timestamp, which is when the ticket status was last updated.
name: metric_set_status_updated_at

description: Indicates the metrics set initially assigned at timestamp, which is when the ticket was initially assigned.
name: metric_set_initially_assigned_at

description: Iindicates the metrics set assigned at timestamp, which is when the ticket was assigned.
name: metric_set_assigned_at

description: Indicates the metrics set solved at timestamp, which is when the ticket was solved.
name: metric_set_solved_at

description: Indicates the metric set latest comment added at timestamp, which is when the latest comment was added to the ticket.
name: metric_set_latest_comment_added_at

description: Indicates the metrics set reply time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time taken to reply to the ticket in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_reply_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: Indicates the metrics set reply time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time taken to reply to the ticket in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_reply_time_in_minutes_business

description: Indicates the metrics set first resolution time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time taken to resolve the ticket in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_first_resolution_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: Indicates the metrics set first resolution time in minutes for business time, which is the time taken to resolve the ticket in business minutes.
name: metric_set_first_resolution_time_in_minutes_business

description: Indicates the metrics set full resolution time in minutes for calendar time, which is the total time taken to resolve the ticket in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_full_resolution_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: Indicates set full resolution time in minutes business time, which is the total time taken to resolve the ticket in business minutes.
name: metric_set_full_resolution_time_in_minutes_business

description: Indicates the metrics set agent wait time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time the agent waited before responding to the ticket in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_agent_wait_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: Indicates the metrics set agent wait time in minutes business time, which is the time the agent waited before responding to the ticket in business minutes.
name: metric_set_agent_wait_time_in_minutes_business

description: Indicates the set requester wait time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time the requester waited before the agent responded in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_requester_wait_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: The metrics set requester wait time in minutes for business time, which is the time the requester waited before the agent responded in business minutes.
name: metric_set_requester_wait_time_in_minutes_business

description: The metrics set on hold time in minutes for calendar time, which is the time the ticket was on hold in calendar minutes.
name: metric_set_on_hold_time_in_minutes_calendar

description: The metrics set on hold time in minutes business time, which is the time the ticket was on hold in business minutes.
name: metric_set_on_hold_time_in_minutes_business

description: Indicates the via source from address, which is the email address or source from which the ticket was created.
name: via_source_from_address

description: Indicates the via source from name, which is the name of the source from which the ticket was created.
name: via_source_from_name

description: Indicates the via source to name, which is the name of the source to which the ticket was sent.
name: via_source_to_name

description: The via source to address, which is the email address or source to which the ticket was sent.
name: via_source_to_address
